instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> how to test switching mosfet
threads.message:
2016 MacBook Pro 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-10, how do I test the switching mosfets <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> etc. I'm suspecting they're the reason battery isn't charging
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> how to test switching mosfet
threads.message:
Remove them and check out of board.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&q=how+test+mosfet+using+multimeter[/URL]

They should be good, if you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without battery.
